summary: Includes over 600 unlockable, craftable mage items for UNP plus a bag of plenty for the dudes.
descriptionHtml:
[color=gold]1.0) DESCRIPTION
2.0) INSTALLATION & PREREQUISITES
3.0) TROUBLESHOOTING & FAQ
4.0) PERMISSIONS, SUGGESTIONS & CONTRIBUTIONS
5.0) CREDITS[/color]

[color=gold]1.0) DESCRIPTION[/color]
The Art of Magicka (AOM) is an artwork and item expansion for Skyrim mages. But it is more than that. Combined with any magicka overhaul, AOM will help to reinvent the Skyrim mage experience by adding a dye system, powerful unlockable gear and over 600 craftable items (most of which are entirely new).

HIGH-REZ TEXTURES: Most of the robes are scaled to 4096. The robe normal maps use 8.8.8.8 ARGB. These are very large and mostly uncompressed files but provide an amazing level of detail when a texture is crafted from photographic imagery (as these robes are). Most of the non-robe items use standard file sizes and formats.

LOW-REZ TEXTURES: Almost every texture and normal map has been set to 1024. For people using a lot of mods or with low-end/older machines this will provide the best stability. If you experience a CTD when scrolling through the crafting menu, use this.

[color=lightblue]1.1) PIGMENTS & LINENS[/color]
Pigments (dyes) and colored linens are crafted at the Font of Transmutation. Some crafting materials are easy to find but some will require you to kill difficult enemies (or find them on a merchant). Dyed linens are required to make the robes. You can craft them from ancient linens and pigments at a Font of Transmutation.

[color=lightblue]1.2) UNLOCKING NEW ITEMS[/color]
Part of the goal of this mod is to reward players for playing pure mages. As you learn new mage perks you will unlock the ability to craft more powerful items. Some of these items are quite powerful but none of them are "god items" and those that are powerful require dedication to magicka.

[color=lightblue]1.3) CRAFTING STATIONS[/color]
All of the new crafting stations can be found in Dragonsreach and in the Archmage quarters. Any items that have soul gems as an ingredient, call for filled soul gems (other than soul gem crafting). Most of the new items are craftable by any character. The most powerful and unique ones are not.

[color=lightblue]Font of Imbuement[/color]
Accessories
Armor
Clothing
Jewelry

[color=lightblue]Font of Spellcraft[/color]
Scrolls
Staves
Tomes

[color=lightblue]Font of Transmutation[/color]
Crafting Materials
Gems
Ore
Weapons
Miscellaneous

[color=lightblue]1.4) MERCHANTS[/color]
Nearby each set of crafting stations you will find a merchant that will sell a few AOM items, including some crafting materials. Kalell can be found in Dragonsreach and Mightiony can be found in the Hall of Countenance.

[color=gold]1.5)) PATCHES:[/color] A patch for SKYRE is available here. [link=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29375]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29375[/link]

[color=red]2.1) INSTALLATION[/color]
I recommend using Nexus Mod Manager. Otherwise follow the standard manual installation procedures.

[color=lightblue]WHEN UPDATING:[/color] Uninstall all old AOM files first (especially the ARTOFMAGIC.esp). When updating from 7.8 - 8.0 a clean save in not neccessary. Just uninstall 7.8's multiple files and install 8.0's single file and play. All items, except the orb of eyes, will still be there.

[color=gold]2.1) PREREQUISITES[/color]
For female bodies to work correctly, this file requires [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=6709]Dimon99's UNP[/url] or any body with a UNP or UNPB compatible texture. Version 8.0 and beyond require a maximum compatibility skeleton or CTD will occur with some outfits. [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26800]XP32 maximum compatibility skeleton[/url] is recommended for easy installation. [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/16712]Custom Skeleton Replacers[/url] is also available for advanced modders .

[color=lightblue]2.2) OPTIONAL FILES[/color]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=14584]Low Res Textures by sparrowjuice[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=13607]ADEC version by gameLvr85 [/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12650]Czech translation by Azarian[/url]
[url=http://modgames.net/load/252-1-0-8959]Russian translation at Modgames.net[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24304]Deutch Translation by Verodor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53347/?]Polish Translation by LordTorus[/url]


[color=gold]3.0) TROUBLESHOOTING & FAQ[/color]

I'm New and I Have a Problem
Welcome to the Nexus. The first thing that you should know is that Nexus Mod Manager is in beta. There will be imperfections. Please take the time to check out the Nexus Forums if you have questions and/or problems. Check out the following Nexus article that the Nexus won't let me link to for some reason. It will help you learn how to fix issues you may experience and become a better, more informed Nexus citizen.

http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/articles/287/

Downloading Issues
If a file on the Nexus doesn't download, try again later. This is a common issue for files on the nexus and is beyond my control. If you have trouble you can download manually and choose the server that is closest to you because NMM just picks whichever one has the least users and you're more likely to get disconnected when downloading such a large file. After downloading go into NMM and select OPEN, then navigate to wherever you downloaded the file to and install it with NMM. If you need further help, there are multiple threads in the Nexus forum addressing various download issues.

CTD
The most common cause of crashes is improper installation. Make sure that you have both AOM.esm and AOM.esp activated in NMM or the data files section of the Skyrim launcher and that the old ARTOFMAGIC.esp has been deactivated. Some other things that may cause problems are edited .ini files, out of date graphics drivers or old versions of Skyrim.

UglyKidCid recently added inventory views to all items. This should eliminate most CTD's during inventory view. If you still get a CTD in inventory view use the low-rez texture pack. 1st Person Maximum Compatibility Skeleton is also required for version 8.0 or later

If you experience a CTD at load disable AOM.esm and AOM.esp and load a previous save. Create a new save and re-enable AOM.esm and AOM.esp and restore your .ini files.

ISSUES AFTER UNINSTALLING
If you experience errors after uninstalling AOM manually remove AOM.esm and AOM.esp then go in to the skyrim/data folder and delete the skyrim/data/meshes/art of magic and skyrim/data/textures art of magic folders. AOM uses no scripts and makes no changes to anything but a few world spaces and items. Also, install and use the Skyrim Save Game Debloatifier to avoid issues after uninstalling mods.

[color=lightblue]3.1) KNOWN ISSUES[/color]
*The hooded version of the nocturnal robe shows black hair. It uses Nocturnal's hair color by default. There is no way for me to fix this. Use showracemenu with the hood equipped to change its color. There isn't any other fix that I am aware of as this appears to be hard-coded into the game.

[color=lightblue]3.2) FAQ[/color]

[color=lightblue]"Is AOM an item replacer?"[/color]
Yes and no. Most of the items in AOM are stand-alone. Nocturnal's clothes, Psiijic robes, Dark Brotherhood robes and necromancer robes have been replaced.

[color=lightblue]"Does this mod edit a lot of stuff? Is it invasive? Are tehre Scripts?"[/color]
AOM does not alter any vendor inventories. It does not alter any leveled lists. One minor script for the night eye effect has been added but is not known to cause any issues.

[color=lightblue]"What might cause conflicts?"[/color]
Three small fonts have been added to Dragonsreach and the Archmage Quarters. There should be limited interference with other mods that use that worldspace. Vendors have been added; one to Dragonsreach and one to Hall of Countenance. They are a part of their own factions and should coexist with other mods that add or edit NPCs without any problems. Additionally, five bags containing witch elf armor sets have been hidden across Skyrim. You will recognize them by their hearts (that's a clue).

The greatest potential for conflicts comes from using mods that alter the necromancer robes, Dark Brotherhood robes, Psiijic robes or Nocturnal's clothes. Loading the AOM.esp after other files that mod them should resolve any issues.

[color=lightblue]"What perks have been altered?"[/color]
AOM does not alter any perks - it simply requires already existing perks to unlock some items. If you use a mod that removes or renames some of these perks the worst possible outcome is that you simply won't have access to an item.

[color=lightblue]"What perks do I need to craft each item?"[/color]
I would prefer not to say. And please do not post your findings in the discussion thread. I will tell you that the perks make sense. Bard armor requires bardic perks. Thief armor requires thief perks. Restoration robes require a great deal of devotion to restoration. If you are seriously interested, you can open the construction kit and see the requirements.

[color=lightblue]"Will you make this file compatible with ____ body?"[/color]
No. But I freely allow all conversions of this work so long as it is not to create a stand alone item. That means that if you would like to create an AOM for SkyRe or whatever, you are free to do so. That also means that if you want to just take all of the items and add them to a chest somewhere, I don't care. Go for it.

[color=lightblue]"What happened to the CBBE version?"[/color]
Due to a high number of reported problems that are only appearing on CBBE items, I am halting development of AOM for CBBE as of version 8.0. I do not know if or when I will continue work on a CBBE version of AOM.

[color=lightblue]"Why are your textures so large?" [/color]
Because I like the vastly improved level of detail afforded by 4096 textures. If you can't tell the difference between 4096 and 2048 textures or don't want to blow so much computing power on such large textures please use [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=14584]Art of Magicka Low Res Textures by sparrowjuice[/url].

[color=lightblue]"Why don't you show images of every item?"[/color]
Because that would be a lot of pictures and it is often more fun to discover them for yourself anyway. There are enough pictures that you should be able to get an idea of what AOM does.

[color=lightblue]"What craftable items are included in AOM?"[/color]
The current working version of AOM includes...

160 Nocturnal robes
61 tomes
60 Psiijic robes
60 scrolls
46 staves
42 cloaks
34 underwear
27 new crafting materials
21 cloth boots
21 cloth gloves
20 skirts
19 dresses
16 amulets
16 tops
11 hoodless masks
10 corsets
10 leather armors
8 magical gems
6 leather gloves
6 bags of holding
5 circlets
4 leather boots
4 piercings
3 chokers
3 rings
2 weapons
1 armband
...and a partridge in a pear tree.

In addition to that there are a limited number of items that cannot be crafted.

[color=lightblue]"Why is pigment so hard to make?"[/color]
Just like in real medieval times, creating colored fabrics is a difficult process. You can purchase linen wraps and pigment from AOM merchants. Use these to make the dyed linens required to craft items.

[color=lightblue]"Where do I get linen wraps?"[/color]
They are scattered around throughout most dungeons.

[color=lightblue]"Where do I get elegant patterns?"[/color]
They can be purchased from AOM vendors.

[color=lightblue]"Why do the Vaermina robes require Vaermina robes to craft?"[/color]
Default Vaermina's robes already exist within the game but use a crappy texture. They are dropped by Vaermina monks. Note that there is a very limited number of them.

[color=lightblue]"Can I convert this to _____ language?"[/color]
Yes. You do not have to get my permission to translate this mod. If you do, send me a link and I will post it in the optional files section.

[color=lightblue]"Will you make an item into a stand-alone mod?"[/color]
No. I want this to be an overhaul for mages. You are of course free to make your own stand-alone mods based on anything here so long as you do not upload them for others. You are also free to make mods based on AOM so long as it is not to add a stand-alone item.

[color=lightblue]"Will you please make items less revealing?"[/color]
Probably not.


[color=gold]4.0) PERMISSIONS, SUGGESTIONS & CONTRIBUTIONS[/color]

The contents of this work are provided under creative commons licensing provided you follow two rules.

1.) Please do not separate out items and create stand-alone versions of them. Some of the components of this mod (witch elf armor for example) are borrowed with permission. I do not have permission to make them stand-alone item sets.

2.) Do not upload any part of this mod or any item taken from this mod on Steam Workshop. Support the Nexus. Click on some advertisements too.

FURTHER THOUGHTS: Items from AOM have been used in several other mods that add multiple items, create new items and reskin clothing. That is all acceptable.

Some people believe that mods must compete with one another for endorsements. Screw those people. The Nexus modding community is comprised of some great people and has long fostered a friendly collaborative environment. I believe that AOM continues this tradition.

I am a professional Photoshop user. I have a background in advanced photo-editing and in graphic design. My love of video games has brought me to step into the world of modding - first as a texture artist and then as a CK noob. AOM is my first mod. I cannot model for crap and I am no CK master, so this is how I can contribute to a modding community that I have long enjoyed.

You can contribute too. If you would like to edit, upgrade or work on this mod, please feel free to so long as you follow the two simple rules posted above. If you do create something let me know. I'll link it.

[color=gold]5.0) CREDITS[/color]
I receive many compliments and endorsements for this mod but they are not mine alone. The Art of Magicka is truly a community mod, with resources provided by many authors. If you endorse AOM please take the time to acknowledge these great mod authors and endorse their files too. Thank you to...

Bethesda (for the wonderful game)
Kalell (for the many meshes)
Fixs (for the hoods with hair)
CD Projekt Red (for freely sharing your [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=5135]Triss Outfit[/url] and other [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5588]Witcher 2 Models[/url])
The Nexus (for hosting The Art of Magicka)
Fraper (for importing the [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=5135]Triss Outfit For TES V[/url])
Zackdip (for the use of [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=1854]Psiijic Re-Skin several versions[/url] by Gyo)
Backsteppo (for the use of [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11767]Dragons Crown Sorceress Outfit[/url] and the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9387]Dragon Quest 3 Sage Outfit[/url] )
crazyjoe2k (for the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12409]Mystical Fountains[/url])
Squizzo (for [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19319]Witch Elf Armour - UNP[/url])
Telthalion (for allowing me to incorporate the excellent [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=2688]Elegant Nocturnal Robes[/url])
L0rd0fWar (for importing [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5588]The Witcher 2 Models[/url])
Jammer (for freely sharing his [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9543]Body Piercings with Collar and Wrist Shackles[/url])
KURESE (for the use of [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15529]R18Pn Set - Inner Wear Set[/url])
PrivateEye (for allowing me to include his imported [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=16637]Ashland Amulets[/url] and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15579]Bipolar Blade[/url])
MightionNY (for the persistant beta-testing)
johneh87 (for Ring of ultravision http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14609)
Cotyounoyume (for a little sexy apparel replacer http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/5564)
[color=lightblue]All who have endorsed, posted images and given feedback[/color]
author: Zonzai and Kalell and UKC
